page.title: 08Shortbrook Fun Day
page.content: On June 8th. 1985, Shortbrook Social and Junior Sports Club on Westfield Estate held its 2nd annual fun day on Shortbrook School Field. Different organisations had stalls on the playground such as a goldfish stall, a coconut shy, greetings cards, hoop-la, and cheese and wine. Shortbrook School had 2 stalls: a plant stall (plants grown by the 12 year old children); and a tame-life park which gave you the chance to win a cuddly teddy bear. The day was opened by the Lord Mayor of Sheffield, Councillor Mrs. Dorothy Walton J.P. The proceeds from the 2 school stalls went to the "Sam the Scan" appeal which is trying to buy a body scanner for the local hospital. Also on the field were 5-a-side football, a bouncy castle, football target practice and a tug-of-war.
